document.masterDocTitle: A review species of the genus Ceroplastes (Hemiptera: Coccomorpha: Coccidae) in China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review species of the genus Ceroplastes (Hemiptera: Coccomorpha: Coccidae) in China

bibRefCitation.author: Maskell, W. M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Maskell, W. M. (1893) Further coccid notes: with descriptions of new species from Australia, India, Sandwich Islands, Demerara and South Pacific. Transactions and Proceedings of the New Zealand Institute, 25, 201 - 252.

Distribution in China .
Widely distributed in southern parts of China outdoors and it also occurs indoors in northern China; the highest populations are found in East, Central and Southwest China.

Host-plants.
Ceroplastes rubens
is a polyphagous species. In China , it can infest over 40 plant species belonging to 24 families; preferred hosts include:
Camellia
spp.,
Cedrus deodara , Cinnamomum
spp.,
Citrus
spp.,
Ilex cornuta
,
Magnolia
spp., and
Pinus
spp. ( Wang 2001 ).

Remarks.
Ceroplastes rubens
can easily be distinguished from the other
Ceroplastes
species in China by the appearance of its wax cover, and by the adult female having reduced and distorted legs.
